title: Calibration Bands
text: R package assess calibration binary outcome predictions. Authored Timo Dimitriadis (Heidelberg University), Alexander Henzi (University Bern), Marius Puke (University Hohenheim).

title: Calibration Bands
text: current version available GitHub.

title: Calibration Bands
text: Use ggplot2:autolayer customize plot. ```
code: library(calibrationband) library(dplyr) set.seed(123) s=.8 n=10000 x <- runif(n) p <- function(x,s){p = 1/(1+((1/x*(1-x))^(s+1)));return(p)} dat <- tibble::tibble(pr=x, s=s, cep = p(pr,s), y=rbinom(n,1,cep))%>% dplyr::arrange(pr)  cb <- calibration_bands(x=dat$pr, y=dat$y,alpha=0.05, method = "round", digits = 3) print(cb) # prints autoplot and summary, see also autoplot(.) and summary(.) #> Areas of misscalibration (ordered by length). In addition there are 1 more.  #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>    min_x max_x #>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0.0396 0.299 #> 2 0.693  0.951 #> 3 0.957  0.957 #> # … with 1 more row autoplot(cb,approx.equi=500, cut.bands = F,p_isoreg = NA,p_ribbon = NA,p_diag = NA)+   ggplot2::autolayer(     cb,     cut.bands = F,     p_diag = list(low = "green", high = "red", guide = "none", limits=c(0,1)),     p_isoreg = list(linetype = "dashed"),     p_ribbon = list(alpha = .1, fill = "red", colour = "purple")                      )

what: Confidence bands for monotone probabilities — calibration_bands
title: Confidence bands for monotone probabilities — calibration_bands
text: Confidence bands monotone probabilities

title: Confidence bands for monotone probabilities — calibration_bands
code: calibration_bands(   x,   y,   alpha = 0.05,   method = "standard",   digits = NULL,   nc = FALSE )

title: Confidence bands for monotone probabilities — calibration_bands
text: x covariate. y response variable (0,1). alpha type one error probability (1 minus confidence level). method "standard" original method proposed article, "round" rounding covariate, "YB" bounds Yang & Barber (2019). digits number digits method "round". Default 2. effect methods. nc use non-crossing bands method "standard" "round". effect method "YB". Default FALSE. See also "summary(...,iso_test=TRUE)" context. Crossings allow reject null hypothesis monotonicity calibration curve.

title: Confidence bands for monotone probabilities — calibration_bands
text: object class calibrationband, list containing following entries:

title: Plotting monotone confidence bands — plot.calibrationband
text: Uses ggplot2 package illustrate monotone confidence bands assess calibration prediction methods issue probability forecasts.

title: Plotting monotone confidence bands — plot.calibrationband
code: # S3 method for calibrationband autoplot(   object,   ...,   approx.equi = NULL,   cut.bands = FALSE,   p_ribbon = NULL,   p_isoreg = NULL,   p_diag = NULL )  # S3 method for calibrationband autolayer(   object,   ...,   approx.equi = NULL,   cut.bands = FALSE,   p_diag = NA,   p_isoreg = NA,   p_ribbon = NA )  # S3 method for calibrationband plot(x, ...)

title: Plotting monotone confidence bands — plot.calibrationband
text: object object class calibrationband ... arguments passed methods. approx.equi NULL, bands drawn prediction-realization pair. scalar, say z,  bounds approximated z equidistant point x-axis. Also see effect cut.bands scalar specified. large data sets, approx.equi = NULL  might result capacity-consuming plots. cases, recommend set approx.equi  equal value least 200. Note, add important additional points initial scalar approx.equi assure accurate transition areas (changes miscalibrated calibrated areas). cut.bands Cut bands extreme prediction values. Bands extended 0 1 respectively option set equal true. p_ribbon non NULL, ribbon drawn. Contains list arguments ggplot2::geom_polygon. See details default list settings. p_isoreg non NULL isotonic regression curve drawn. Contains list arguments ggplot2::geom_line. See details default list settings. p_diag non NULL, diagonal line drawn. Contains list arguments ggplot2::geom_segment. x object class calibrationband

title: Plotting monotone confidence bands — plot.calibrationband
text: object inheriting class 'ggplot'.

title: Plotting monotone confidence bands — plot.calibrationband
text: plotting monotone confidence band, upper bound extended left, , bound x[] valid interval (x[-1],x[]]. lower bound extended right, .e. bound x[] extended interval [x[],x[+ 1]). function creates x y values correct plotting bounds. autoplot behaves like ggplot() + layer() combination. means, customized plots created using autoplot autolayer. Setting p_* arguments NA disables layer. Default parameter values p_*

title: Plotting monotone confidence bands — plot.calibrationband
code: s=.8 n=10000 x <- sort(runif(n))  p <- function(x,s){p = 1/(1+((1/x*(1-x))^(s+1)));return(p)} dat <- data.frame(pr=x, y=rbinom(n,1,p(x,s)))  cb <- calibration_bands(x=dat$pr, y=dat$y,alpha=0.05, method="round", digits =3)  #simple plotting plot(cb)  autoplot(cb)   #customize the plot using  ggplot2::autolayer autoplot( cb, approx.equi=NULL, p_ribbon = NA )+ ggplot2::autolayer( cb, p_ribbon = list(alpha = .3, fill = "gray", colour = "blue"), )

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. ggplot2 autolayer, autoplot

title: summarize calibration band  object — summary.calibrationband
text: object class calibrationband contains calibration band coordinates, pairs original observation forecast values, recalibrated forecasts obtained isotonic regression. function summary.reliabilitydiag calculates areas miscalibration.

title: summarize calibration band  object — summary.calibrationband
code: # S3 method for calibrationband summary(object, ..., iso_test = FALSE, n = 3)

title: summarize calibration band  object — summary.calibrationband
text: object object class calibrationband ... arguments passed methods. iso_test default = FALSE. TRUE, decision isotonicity test reported along side crossings band. calibrationband calculated nc=TRUE, bands re-estimated nc=FALSE using digits=3. alpha calibrationband used. n number rows output table.

title: summarize calibration band  object — summary.calibrationband
text: 'summary.reliability' object, also tibble (see tibble::tibble()) columns:

title: summarize calibration band  object — summary.calibrationband
code: set.seed(123) s=.8 n=10000 x <- sort(runif(n))  p <- function(x,s){p = 1/(1+((1/x*(1-x))^(s+1)));return(p)} dat <- data.frame(pr=x, y=rbinom(n,1,p(x,s)))  cb <- calibration_bands(x=dat$pr, y=dat$y,alpha=0.05, method="round", digits =3)  summary(cb) #>  #>  Areas of misscalibration (ordered by length). In addition there are 8 more.  #> # A tibble: 11 × 2 #>    min_x max_x #>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0.760  0.967 #> 2 0.0724 0.222 #> 3 0.744  0.746 #> # … with 8 more rows #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows print(summary(cb), n=5) #>  #>  Areas of misscalibration (ordered by length). In addition there are 8 more.  #> # A tibble: 11 × 2 #>    min_x max_x #>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0.760  0.967 #> 2 0.0724 0.222 #> 3 0.744  0.746 #> # … with 8 more rows #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows
